runs.comm: wide of off, Jayawardene tries to cut and crunches it down into the ground
oh, good ball, that one nips back in and beats the inside edge of Mahela, who was wafting a long way away from his body
beaten again! Well wide of off, Jayawardene launches a big aggressive drive and can't make contact
driven to cover, Warner does the fielding and prevents a single
bouncer! That one sails over the head of Jayawardene and it's high enough to be called a wide, Sri Lanka are off the mark
good length from McKay, Jayawardene nudges to mid on and takes off for a quick single
beaten outside off again! As it was in Australia's first few overs, Sri Lanka are struggling to pick the bounce
yorker wide of off to begin, it's jammed away to cover and Warner hurls himself to his left and saves the run, great fielding
that's a good cut, Nannes bangs it in short and Jayawardene waits for it, slashes that over backward point and there's nobody in the deep there
angled bat from Mahela, he guides it to third man
another boundary, Dilshan clips it confidently through midwicket and finds the gap, Nannes has to find the right line pretty quickly here
sharp bounce! That was quick and was on the rise as it got to Haddin, who did very well to get his right hand up to save four byes there
more runs! Great cover drive finds the gap and that's a wonderful over for Sri Lanka
the runs are really flowing now, Jayawardene backs off just a fraction and drives safely over cover, strikes it cleanly and finds the boundary
another boundary through cover, this time Mahela crunched it lower but still through the gap, perfect placement
he goes for the hook this time and that's skied towards fine leg, half a chance for Nannes but he can't get in there in time and it lands safely
nudged into the turf and to slip and it's a no-ball, so here comes a free hit
shortish and he goes for a hefty pull, the top edge is taken by Haddin but it was a free hit, just a single
turned around to fine leg for a single
slower ball turned to square leg, they think about a single but wisely decide against it
good ball but what a magnificent shot! It was straight, on a good length and Jayawardene stepped back and punched it between the bowler and mid-off, it's raced away for a boundary. What a stroke!
the runs are really coming quickly! He's got a short ball now and pulled it over square leg
this time Jayawardene can't get it away, backs off and tries to punch through off and it's beaten the bat and sailed over the stumps
Siddle gets the breakthrough! Good ball, nipping away from the batsman, who tried to slap it over midwicket and got a little edge through to Haddin
angled in and Chandimal bunts it to leg, thinks about a single but Siddle hares across to stop any run
driven wide of mid on, the fielder can't get across to stop it and mid-off has to chase it down
Dilshan uses the pace and slashes it through point, in the air but safely and it flies away to the boundary
much better ball, Nannes gets this one on the stumps and it's full enough; Dilshan tries to lift it over the bowler's head and just gets a thick edge back into his pads
on the hips, it's worked away to square leg

gone! Nannes gets the breakthough with a fullish ball that's going on to hit the stumps, Chandimal got across in line but at first glance that looked like it pitched outside leg. Bruce Oxenford didn't think so.
full and wide of off, Sangakkara edges it away to third man to get off the mark
short and pulled away to fine leg, Siddle does some really good work to cut that boundary off
beaten outside off, angling across the left-hander

ah, down leg side and Sangakkara gets some pad on that, Haddin's dive can't stop it but Dirk Nannes manages to cut that one off at fine leg, though he gets himself in a tangle in doing so and the ball somehow ends up up his left trouser leg
nudged to midwicket for a quick single
smashed! Positively thumped over midwicket with a strong pull, there's nobody out in the deep there and Dilshan gets another four
chopped down to the off side and there's a quick single on offer
great shot! Straight ball, not a bad one by any means but Sangakkara walks across just enough to allow him to flick it through midwicket, all the way along the ground
he starts at 127kph, it's punched down to long off for a single
angled across Sangakkara, who guides it to gully
driven to cover, can't beat the field
Sangakkara drops it at his feet and can't get a single
driven down the ground to long off
and he mixes things up with a bouncer that sails through at head height, no problem with that one
fullish and angled across Sangakkara, who drives hard through point and David Hussey cuts it off just inside the boundary
shortish this time, Sangakkara turns a gentle pull around through midwicket
good line, on off stump and Dilshan can't beat point
driven to mid-on, again can't beat the field
crunched away through cover, just the single
driven down to long off for a comfortable single
wrong line, down leg side and that's a wide
angled across Sangakkara, who drives through cover
beaten outside off, good ball at 132kph and Hastings got some good bounce from his height
banged in short again, Dilshan pulls it behind square and Siddle runs around from fine leg
Sangakkara waits on that one and nudges to point, Clarke throws at the bowler's end but Dilshan is safely back
soft hands from Sangakkara, he clips it off the pads for a single
another short ball, Dilshan chases it and tries for the upper cut, but can't connect
driven to long off for a single
defended away to cover
short and wide of off, Dilshan cuts uppishly to third man on the bounce
pushed across Sangakkara, who simply nudges that through cover, he's placed it well and timed it such that he can get back for two
more tip and run from Sangakkara, who pushes to off, and that's all they need to do at this stage
good delivery, nibbling away from the right-hander, and it beats his edge
right on line to start with, no real spin though, and it's pushed back to the bowler
short, slow and smashed flat through midwicket for a boundary, in fact that's almost made it over the rope
turned away through the leg side
tossed up and no spin, Dilshan cuts hard and gets it well enough to beat the man at deep cover, great shot
some turn away from Dilshan, who cuts to point and McKay misfields
pushed back to the bowler
on the hips, Dilshan clips it away to fine leg
on the body, it drops at the batsman's feet and they scramble through for a single, which includes a collision between Nannes and Sangakkara
half-volley on off stump, Sangakkara drives to mid off for a single, and in fact there's an overthrow as Smith hurls at the bowler's end with nobody backing up
banged in a bit shorter at 142kph, Sangakkara is happy to sway out of the way of that one
good ball, that was quick and rising, Sangakkara backed off and tried to dab it through point and it's beaten the bat
short again, but this one is called wide, and rightly so as it's quite a way over head height
fuller and wide of off, it's slashed away to deep point
Hastings comes back and is immediately greeted with a boundary, Sangakkara picked it up off his hips and just flicked it through square leg
nudged away off the hips again for a single
driven through cover and there's a reasonably comfortable two to the man in the deep
Dilshan has rocketed that one through cover! Wonderful shot, and the crack off the bat was very, very loud
pulled through midwicket for a couple more
good ball, it's a bouncer that nips back off the pitch and follows Dilshan, who sways out of the way
driven hard and in the air, but safely wide of mid-on and Sangakkara got enough on that for it to fly away to the boundary
short of a length, Sangakkara drops it at his feet and can't get a single
more runs, and what a lovely stroke from Sangakkara. It was short, the batsman pulled that from in front of his eyes and it's been smoked away through midwicket
driven to mid off
pushed to mid on for an easy single
beaten outside off with a ball that bounced a little more than expected
Sangakkara advances down the pitch and Smith pulls his length back, the batsman is good enough to get it away through midwicket

Smith gets a wicket, Dilshan has rather thrown it away there. He's danced down the pitch and tried to slog it over midwicket, his eyes already heading in the direction of his intended shot, but it's turned past him and Haddin whips off the bails
tossed up wide of off, it's been skied over point and lands safely
Sangakkara leans forward and pushes back wide of the bowler, who is athletic enough to dive to his left and cut it off
magnificent. Sangakkara walks down the crease and lifts it from outside off wide of long-on, it's one bounce over the boundary. That's a really superbly-executed shot.
again he advanced and this time checks his shot, just nudges it away
cut away to gully, can't beat the field
shorter and slower ball at 118kph, Sangakkara waits on it and bunts it at his feet
bouncer, Sangakkara ducks underneath it
shorter length, and that's a bit comical as it bounces ever so slowly off the wicket and Sangakkara waits and waits, then leaves it alone. It was 100kph.
nudged away defensively to the off side
again he drops it at his feet, remarkably that's a maiden over from McKay
massive! That's easily the biggest six of the match, Perera has launched that one over long-on, just got to the pitch of the ball and then used all his muscle
he goes for it again, this time doesn't time the ball but gets enough on it that it sails over mid on and bounces away to the boundary
what a way to finish the match! Perera has skied an even bigger six over long-on! It really was a huge six, that's sailed about 20 rows back. Sri Lanka have won, and easily
